sourcesContent:
import Restriction from "./Restriction.js" import "../styles/restrictionsPage.css" import { Link } from "react-router-dom"; function RestrictionsPage() { const country = window.location.search.substring(1).replace(/%20/g, " "); const text = "Passengers travelling to Australia must be tested for COVID-19 72 hours or less prior to the scheduled flight departure, and display evidence of a negative test result at the time of check-in. COVID-19 PCR testing is required. Passengers arriving on a green safe travel zone flight are exempt from pre-departure testing requirements. Countries where COVID-19 PCR testing is not reasonably available are also exempt, as determined by the Australian Government.\n Members of a travelling party who have been primary close contacts (e.g. household contacts) of a traveller who has a positive COVID-19 test result will also not be allowed to travel to Australia until all members of the party are no longer infectious.\n Passengers and crew on all international flights must wear a face mask during their flight and while in an Australian airport. Passengers are also encouraged to wear masks in overseas airports. Masks are not required for children under 12 years of age and those with an official medical certificate stating the passenger cannot wear a mask.\n To prevent the spread of COVID-19, travellers arriving in Australia by air or sea may need to go into government approved mandatory quarantine for 14 days from arrival.You must quarantine in the city you arrive in for 14 days, even if you plan to travel elsewhere in Australia.\n Once you have completed quarantine, you can travel within Australia in line with state and territory domestic travel restrictions. This may include further quarantine requirements.\n You may be tested for COVID-19 in the first 48 hours and then between days 10 to 12 of quarantine. If you refuse testing, you may have to quarantine for a longer period. Exact testing arrangements depend on states and territories.\n In some states and territories, you may also have to pay a contribution to the cost of quarantine." return (
{country}
Read More Return
) } export default RestrictionsPage
